meanings.definition: A tall staff or pole on which a flag is raised.
meanings.sent1: The flagstaff stood proudly in front of the school building.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, they hoisted the national flag on the flagstaff.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed up the flagstaff and pretended to be the flag.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the flagstaff swayed ominously in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight gleamed on the golden knob of the flagstaff, making it shine brightly.

meanings.definition: The city in Arizona, United States.
meanings.sent1: My cousin lives in Flagstaff, a beautiful city surrounded by mountains.
meanings.sent2: Flagstaff is known for its stunning natural beauty and outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: In Flagstaff, even the squirrels seem to enjoy the mountain air.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of adventure fills the streets of Flagstaff like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: When you visit Flagstaff, you can't help but feel the magic of the mountains all around you.
